com.wizzer.mle.runtime.dpp

Class MleDppLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wizzer.mle.runtime.dpp.MleDppLoader

  • public class MleDppLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to load items from the Digital Playprint.
    Author:
    Mark S. Millard

      • getInstance

        public static MleDppLoader getInstance()
        Get the Singleton instance of the DPP loader.
        Returns:
        A reference to the MleDppLoader is returned.

      • mleLoadGroup

        public MleGroup mleLoadGroup(int indexToDppTOC)
                      throws MleDppException,
                             MleRuntimeException
        Load a Group of Actors from the Digital Playprint.
        Parameters:
        indexToDppTOC - The identifier for the Group to load. This is an offset into the Digital Playprint Table-Of-Content.
        Returns:
        The loaded MleGroup is returned. If the Group was not successfully loaded, then null will be returned.
        Throws:
        MleDppException - This exception may be thrown if the Group can not be successfully loaded.
        MleRuntimeException - This exception is thrown if the Group can not be succssfully initialized. It will also be thrown if any of the Group's Actors can not be initialized.

      • mleLoadScene

        public MleScene mleLoadScene(int indexToDppTOC)
                      throws MleDppException,
                             MleRuntimeException
        Load a Scene from the Digital Playprint.
        Parameters:
        indexToDppTOC - The identifier for the Scene to load. This is an offset into the Digital Playprint Table-Of-Content.
        Returns:
        The loaded MleScene is returned. If the Scene was not successfully loaded, then null will be returned.
        Throws:
        MleDppException - This exception may be thrown if the Scene can not be successfully loaded.
        MleRuntimeException - This exception is thrown if the Scene can not be successfully initialized.

      • mleLoadBootScene

        public MleScene mleLoadBootScene()
                          throws MleDppException,
                                 MleRuntimeException
        Bootstrap the title by loading the first Scene.
        Returns:
        A MleScene is returned.
        Throws:
        MleDppException - This exception is thrown if the boot scene can not be loaded from the mastered title tables.
        MleRuntimeException - This exception is thrown if the Scene can not be succssfully initialized.

      • mleLoadSet

        public MleSet mleLoadSet(int indexToDppTOC)
                  throws MleDppException,
                         MleRuntimeException
        Load a Set from the Digital Playprint.
        Parameters:
        indexToDppTOC - The identifier for the Set to load. This is an offset into the Digital Playprint Table-Of-Content.
        Returns:
        The loaded MleSet is returned. If the Set was not successfully loaded, then null will be returned.
        Throws:
        MleDppException - This exception may be thrown if the Set can not be successfully loaded.
        MleRuntimeException - This exception is thrown if the Set can not be succssfully initialized.

      • mleLoadMediaRef

        public MleMediaRef mleLoadMediaRef(int indexToDppTOC)
                            throws MleDppException
        Load a MediaRef from the Digital Playprint.
        Parameters:
        indexToDppTOC - The identifier for the MediaRef to load. This is an offset into the Digital Playprint Table-Of-Content.
        Returns:
        The loaded MleMref is returned. If the MediaRef was not successfully loaded, then null will be returned.
        Throws:
        MleDppException - This exception may be thrown if the Scene can not be successfully loaded.

      • mleLoadPlayprint

        public MleDppInput mleLoadPlayprint(java.lang.String filename,
                                    long type)
        Load the Digital Playprint.
        Parameters:
        filename - The Digital Playprint file.
        type - The type of Digital Playprint to load.
        Returns:
        If the Digital Playprint is successfully loaded, then a reference to a MleDppInput is returned. If the DPP fails to load, then null will be returned.

      • mleUnloadPlayprint

        public void mleUnloadPlayprint(MleDppInput pp)
        Unload the specified Digital Playprint.
        Parameters:
        pp - The Digital Playprint to unload.
